chargeHist.descr: Poessess Firearm - Dom Abuse or Child Abuse Injunction

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Poessess Firearm - Dom Abuse or Child Abuse Injunction

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marquise Montrell Wise

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marquise Montrell Wise appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Marquise Montrell Wise.  Attorney  Jon Josephsen appeared in court on behalf of Abby Rockendorf for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel informs court that he has received discovery materials and an offer from the State, but needs additional time to review with client. Court adjourns matter for an additional status conference date and sets 11/25/2022 deadline to file any motions. Case adjourned to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services 10-10-2022 Supervision Report

Defendant Marquise Montrell Wise appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Marquise Montrell Wise.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Menge. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services 09-19-2022 Supervision Report

Defendant Marquise Montrell Wise in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquise Montrell Wise appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned due to State's Request. State's Witness unable to appear due to being out on FMLA and not receiving subpoena. Defense moves to dismiss. Motion denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Marquise Montrell Wise in court, appear in person.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Marquise Montrell Wise in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Marquise Montrell Wise in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marquise Montrell Wise appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
